abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Kathleen DuVal argues that Senate Republicans' unauthorized open letter to Iran regarding nuclear agreement has precedent in years following American Revolution; holds early attempts by individuals or state governments to negotiate with foreign governments rarely proved successful; contends later creation of office of presidency and Constitution centralized American foreign policy and allowed United States to become rising power; says Republicans' action suggests return to fragmentation and weakness.
lead_paragraph: The history of random Americans negotiating with foreign powers. It didn’t work out.

headline.main: We Have a President for a Reason
headline.seo: A History Lesson for the Republicans Who Wrote to Iran
headline.print_headline: We Have a President for a Reason

snippet: The history of random Americans negotiating with foreign powers. It didn’t work out.
